column4: Blaqlight; you would need to have ssh running in order to do that. once you get ssh up you are fine.

yes we all do
its a virtual filesystem kinda, its not using any space.
just make sure your part of the fuse group or you can't mount cdroms...
among others...
if your not part of the 'fuse' group you can't mount cdroms unless your root :P
I assume it allows common users to read/write removable media/filesystems without being sudo.
after an upgrade I was removed from that group and I had to be sudo to mount/read/write/ cdroms
once added back I had no problems, also the drive would show on the desktop only when I mounted it being a part of the fuse group.
only the latest and greatest :D
